Now in its 4th year, the Influencer Marketing Awards (IMAs) hosted by Talking Influence are centred around:

Celebrating Effective, Creative and Inclusive Collaborations that Authentically Connect Brands with Consumers.

The IMAs mission is to reward individuals, teams, and campaigns that have pushed boundaries, and above all delivered excellence across the board during the last 12 months.

The awards were established in 2018 to recognise best in class activity, rewarding campaigns which demonstrate creativity and innovation, alongside delivering superior results.

As much as this industry is automating and innovating, we maintain that the IMAs seek to honour not only the innovative campaigns that have truly made a difference, but the influencer partnerships that have made campaigns so effective in reaching consumers, and the teams that have worked hard to execute them.

The awards span the breadth and depth of influencer marketing and the creator economy, and much like the industry, are constantly evolving. This year’s IMAs will again be debuting new categories, from Best Long Term Partnership to Best Use of Affiliate Marketing, as we continue to celebrate the ever-changing innovations within the channel.

The awards are global in nature and open to brands, agencies, creators and technology providers. With an international jury of experts and peers debating and determining who will take home gold, silver and bronze awards at our ceremony on June 9, 2022 in London.

Now in its 5th year, the Global Influencer Marketing Awards (GIMAs) hosted by Hello Partner are centered around:

Celebrating Effective, Creative and Inclusive Collaborations that Authentically Connect Brands with Consumers.

The Global IMAs mission is to reward individuals, teams, and campaigns that have pushed boundaries, and above all delivered excellence across the board during the last 12 months.

The awards were established in 2018 to recognise best in class activity, rewarding campaigns which demonstrate creativity and innovation, alongside delivering superior results.

As much as this industry is automating and innovating, we maintain that the IMAs seek to honour not only the innovative campaigns that have truly made a difference, but the influencer partnerships that have made campaigns so effective in reaching consumers, and the teams that have worked hard to execute them.

The awards span the breadth and depth of influencer marketing and the creator economy, and much like the industry, are constantly evolving. This year’s GIMAs will again be debuting new categories, from Best Influencer Commerce Campaign or Strategy to Content Creator of the Year as we continue to celebrate the ever-changing innovations within the channel.
The awards are global in nature and open to brands, agencies, creators and technology providers. With an international jury of experts and peers debating and determining who will take home gold, silver and bronze awards at our ceremony on July 20, 2023 in London.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
